instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board issues
threads.message: Hey guys I got an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> yesterday with attached issue. I ultrasonic the board since I had no clue, it worked fine afterwards.been testing it for 2 days running benchmarks seem ok. Today, I got another one exactly the same issue. This one has a brand new display installed by Apple few days later this occurred. Anyone has an idea what causes it? Looks like Ram or cpu issue? [ATTACH alt="20190403_113452.jpg" type="full"]48089._xfImport[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board issues
threads.message: CPU looks like to me. Just like all the other A1534s

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board issues
threads.message: I ultrasoniced it and this one seems to work as well now,.... mmmm . will run tests for a day see how it holds out.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board issues
threads.message: If reacts after UC, the issue should be generated by crap accumulated between CPU, or RAM balls...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board issues
threads.message:
I had the same issue but it was random. I don't believe you can confirm that the UC did the job.
It might have fix temporarily in my opinion or you are lucky with this board.

CPU is usually bent on the edge which is the problem...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board issues
threads.message: It still hasnt returned:) fingers crossed!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board issues
threads.message: oh and I had a 2nd one with same issue 2 days ago, also started to work again after UC.
